import { BlogPostLayout } from "@/components/blog-post-layout" export default function Page() { // Sample content for demonstration const sampleContent = `

Hearts of Iron IV

Naval AI Crisis

  • Players report AI nations building excessive carriers without proper escort fleets
  • Naval invasion logic appears broken in latest patch 1.14.2
  • Community consensus: needs immediate hotfix
"The AI just stacks 40 carriers and calls it a navy. It's completely immersion-breaking." - Reddit user u/NavalCommander

DLC Fatigue Concerns

  • 7th major DLC announced with mixed reception
  • Price point criticized as too high for content offered
  • Long-time fans expressing burnout

Victoria 3

Economy Rebalance Success

  • Patch 1.5 receives overwhelmingly positive feedback
  • GDP calculations finally feel realistic
  • Trade goods system praised as "finally working"
"This is the Victoria 3 we should have gotten at launch. Better late than never!" - Steam review

Warfare Still Disappointing

  • Combat remains the weakest element of the game
  • Players want more control over military operations
  • Comparison to Victoria 2 warfare system persists

Stellaris

Galactic Community Update

  • Diplomatic gameplay significantly enhanced
  • New resolutions create meaningful late-game decisions
  • Performance improvements noted across the board
` return ( ) }

- H2 section headers (game names like "Hearts of Iron IV", "Victoria 3")
- H3 subheaders (topics like "Naval AI Crisis", "DLC Quality Concerns")
- Bullet point lists
- Blockquotes (community quotes)
- Horizontal rules between sections

The component receives: title, date, contentHtml (rendered markdown string).
Use Tailwind CSS. Make it visually engaging and clear, not flat.


Design direction: CARD-BASED
- Each major section (H2) should feel like its own contained card with subtle background/border
- Use shadows and rounded corners for depth
- Section headers should be bold and distinctive
- Pull quotes should stand out with accent styling
- Clean, modern, slightly corporate feel (think Stripe blog)
